Description: Fragment of a pottery amphora; rim, strap handle and part of body; reconstructed from six fragments; raised ridge at shoulder-neck join. Black stripe on inside of rim; black glaze on rim, neck and outside of handle; row of short vertical strokes on the shoulder below the neck exept underneath handle; to both sides of handle two black vertical stripes; horizontal black band around body at height of handle base; in shoulder zone, two cross-shaped ornaments to sides of handle. Hard, fine, orange/brown clay, Munsell between 10R 6/6 and 2.5YR 6/6 (light red); many white inclusions.
Bibliographic references: Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 345)
Acquisition notes: Found unregistered in the Department in 2010, in a box with other sherds from Tell Dafana.
